text:
For those of you who regionalize, what do you do for global regionalizations in the english language? For example, I have a site that will be regionalized (translated) for Pakistan, but the content will be in English. do i choose English and wind up having the URL as /en/en-pk, which I really do not like the redundancy, or choose Urdu for the language and put my content in English anyhow, …..? How have others solved this?

I don’t want to start experimenting, because I see that you can’t remove a translation once it’s started (which is a huge problem as well).
I had a client print a pdf ebook and anotate it with red marker then send it to me via fed ex. A 50 page ebook
Hi guys...
We've got a WordPress site that has HubSpot forms/blogs etc integrated with it. At the min, we've been given the dreaded "the Speed score needs to be amazing" brief
Just wondering if anyone has had any success reducing the cdn ones I'm seeing in the image above?
I've managed to reduce a lot, with images and using `async` and `defer` where applicable, but need to keep in mind not to affect the UX too much making these amends
<@U9MAWTESW> I’ve been there. the plugin, fast velocity minify, might help you combine those resources into one.
oh, cool.  let me know if you use that plugin and if it works
it can be dangerous lol. But it has saved me a couple of times.
Luckily I'm testing this on a staging site first :smile:
Just looking at the files, you might can move the slick.css files (if slick isn’t above the fold), and the offcanvas-menu.js to the footer
if you can go to font awesome5, they allow loading with js
Do I use `import` with `slick.css` in the body?
<https://varvy.com/pagespeed/render-blocking-css.html>

On a different note, one time we had a client who came back from a marketing conference and they immediately demanded a better pagespeed score. We tested some amazon product pages and showed the client that their score was better than amazon. That got em off our backs lol

Ah yeah, I've thought this myself so tested a few major sites and this one is doing great. Currently at 95 Desktop, but 48 mobile. If I can get the mobile higher, the client will be happy (I hope) :smile:
have you tried the  Autoptimze plugin on with WP?
<https://www.keycdn.com/blog/google-pagespeed-insights-wordpress>
this is a pretty good article reference i've used to get some good page speed scores
They were most likely asserting dominance, you should of fixed it printed it out and sent it back with a smiley face sticker
Cheers guys, will give both a try and see if it helps :raised_hands:

Lets talk about form validation with HS.... who has used what for it? for example a number field like zip code to make sure people dont enter in "I am the walrus" instead of a something like "99999"
i get a lot of grief from our QA team about the forms
likewise
we are also starting to get it with some clients
And make that || a &&
fixed
This only works if you use the embed. What about with the module?
<@U26DA9CQ0> thank you, thats what i was thinking is it would have to be done through the embed `onFormSubmit`
when using the module, I dont know if its possible at all...
it isnt

I'm trying to pull some content based on tags that are determined by a field selection but does not seem to be working. See {{ module.tag_field }}. If I state the particular tag it works but not when I try to make it selectable. Does anyone know how to make this work? {% set posts = blog_recent_topic_posts('0000000, {{ module.tag_field}}, 3) %}
Also I mistyped it should be {% set posts = blog_recent_topic_posts('0000000', {{ module.tag_field}}, 3) %}
get rid of the brackets from the module.tag
Thank you, lol. I knew it would be something simple...

hey HubSpot team, to the person who wrote the real estate hubdb tutorial -- you deserve props,  i have referred so many people to that tutorial.  I am a young buck in the HubSpot world, but this is the best one that i have seen.  Seems relevant to many topics.  Cant wait to see more content like  it
i will buy you a drink at emmet's
(or bar of your choosing, but emmet's is the best)
